intro: Bartsia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved bartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky areas. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are usually less than 2 centimeters in length. It produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months.
